meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of protozoa.
meanings.sent1: The tiny pond was home to many protozoic creatures.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the behavior of protozoic organisms in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: The protozoic party in the petri dish was a hit among the microbiologists.
meanings.sent4: Her movements on the dance floor were as swift and unpredictable as a protozoic organism.
meanings.sent5: The microscope revealed a colorful world of protozoic life thriving in the water droplet.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the earliest geological era, characterized by the appearance of unicellular organisms.
meanings.sent1: The fossil record provides evidence of protozoic life forms from ancient times.
meanings.sent2: The protozoic era marked a significant milestone in the history of life on Earth.
meanings.sent3: The museum exhibit showcased replicas of protozoic creatures from millions of years ago.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting depicted a surreal landscape reminiscent of the protozoic era.
meanings.sent5: The layers of sediment revealed traces of protozoic activity from a bygone era.
